content.raw:
“““

Imports should be grouped in the following order:

1. Standard library imports.
2. Related third party imports.
3. Local application/library specific imports.

You should put a blank line between each group of imports.

“““

[https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0008/#imports](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0008/#imports)

Applies to `path` and `tables` also

“““

Imports should be grouped in the following order:

  1. Standard library imports.
  2. Related third party imports.
  3. Local application/library specific imports.

You should put a blank line between each group of imports.

“““

https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0008/#imports

Applies to path and tables also

content.raw: Do not use bare except. We want any “real” exceptions that occur to actually be raised. If there’s an exception in particular that you think should be ignored, then catch that specific one and comment why it’s being ignored.
content.html: Do not use bare except. We want any “real” exceptions that occur to actually be raised. If there’s an exception in particular that you think should be ignored, then catch that specific one and comment why it’s being ignored.

content.raw: @mjmm13 done reviewing this round. Let me know when you’ve made your changes.
content.html: @mjmm13 done reviewing this round. Let me know when you’ve made your changes.

content.raw: Why catch the OSError? What specifically are you trying to catch and ignore here? Could you add a comment to the code here as well to be explicit that the specific exceptions are expected and should be ignored?
content.html: Why catch the OSError? What specifically are you trying to catch and ignore here? Could you add a comment to the code here as well to be explicit that the specific exceptions are expected and should be ignored?

content.raw: Added comments explaining the changes
content.html: Added comments explaining the changes

content.raw: Presumably there are other possible OSErrors that could occur here \(other than when pkg-config is not installed\). Perhaps you have to [check the errno value](https://docs.python.org/2/library/errno.html) if it is OSError for the correct error you are interested in and re-raise the OSError exception otherwise \(with `raise`\).
content.html: Presumably there are other possible OSErrors that could occur here (other than when pkg-config is not installed). Perhaps you have to check the errno value if it is OSError for the correct error you are interested in and re-raise the OSError exception otherwise (with raise).

content.raw: This number \(2\) is system dependent \(different errors _may_ be assigned to different numbers\). This should be one of the constants defined in the [standard python errno package.](https://docs.python.org/2/library/errno.html) I’m not sure how you concluded specifically where the number 2 came from, but you can look it up. My best initial guess it is \`ENOENT\` \(no entity or file not found\).
content.html: This number (2) is system dependent (different errors may be assigned to different numbers). This should be one of the constants defined in the standard python errno package. I’m not sure how you concluded specifically where the number 2 came from, but you can look it up. My best initial guess it is `ENOENT` (no entity or file not found).

content.raw: ENOENT is correct, I had found the error number by looking for it, after receiving the error on the VM
content.html: ENOENT is correct, I had found the error number by looking for it, after receiving the error on the VM

content.html: @hoffman this is ready for your review

content.raw:
```
pkg_config_cflags = split(check_output(["pkg-config", "--cflags", "hdf5"]))
pkg_config_libs = split(check_output(["pkg-config", "--libs", "hdf5"]))
```

Uses `shlex.split()` instead of `str.split()`.
content.html:
pkg_config_cflags = split(check_output(["pkg-config", "--cflags", "hdf5"]))
pkg_config_libs = split(check_output(["pkg-config", "--libs", "hdf5"]))

Uses shlex.split() instead of str.split().

content.raw:
```
LDFLAGS_LIBRARY_SWITCH = "-l"
LDFLAGS_LIBRARY_PATH_SWITCH = "-L"
CFLAGS_INCLUDE_PATH_SWITCH = "-I"
```
content.html:
LDFLAGS_LIBRARY_SWITCH = "-l"
LDFLAGS_LIBRARY_PATH_SWITCH = "-L"
CFLAGS_INCLUDE_PATH_SWITCH = "-I"

content.raw:
```
for word in pkg_config_libs:
    if not word.startswith(LDFLAGS_LIBRARY_SWITCH):
        assert word.startswith(LDFLAGS_LIBRARY_PATH_SWITCH)
        library_dirnames.add_dir(word.lstrip(LDFLAGS_LIBRARY_PATH_SWITCH))
```

Similar for `pkg_config_cflags`. Have them in the same order as above (cflags first, then libs)
content.html:
for word in pkg_config_libs:
    if not word.startswith(LDFLAGS_LIBRARY_SWITCH):
        assert word.startswith(LDFLAGS_LIBRARY_PATH_SWITCH)
        library_dirnames.add_dir(word.lstrip(LDFLAGS_LIBRARY_PATH_SWITCH))

Similar for pkg_config_cflags. Have them in the same order as above (cflags first, then libs)
